Class ECAMpostProcessing

java.lang.Object
ECAMpostProcessing
public class ECAMpostProcessing extends Object
Secondary processing of solutions found in ECAasMultiplication, Multiplications B and C, generates output of a ValidSolution, generates the polynomial

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    boolean
    avoidDivZero
    If true, and if normalizeUnit is true, if the radius is zero, set it equal to 1 to avoid division by zero.
    double[][]
    coefficientField
    ValidSolution output data, non-negative real
    Complex[][]
    complexField
    Output of a ValidSolution in multiplicativeSolutionOutput(), complex, Multiplications B, after normalization
    Complex[][][]
    complexVectorField
    Output of a ValidSolution in multiplicativeSolutionOutput(), complex vector, Multiplications B just prior to normalization
    ValidSolution
    currentSolution
    Solution currently being used
    boolean
    doAddititiveWolfram
    If true, it does a binary sum of the real and imaginary parts of the input neighborhood, greater than 0 being 0 and less than 0 being 1, the real and imaginary treated as seperate, and calls the solution's Wolfram code with that value, and depending on the Wolfram code value at that additive spot, it sets it to 0 or -1, depending on wolframIsNegOne
    int[][][]
    factorLayers
    Binary neighborhoods with a valid permutation group applied, each permutation creates a layer, each cell in a layer is a factor in the multiplication
    double[][]
    field
    2D array of doubles with the coefficients of a multiplicativeSolutionOutput()
    double[][]
    fieldFromPolynomial
    same as field[][], except that field mutiplies out the whole numFactors-dim partialProduct[][] table, and this uses the polynomial from generatePolynomial()
    int
    gridSize
    Number of columns in the output, must be larger than the input array parameter in multiplicativeSolutionOutput().
    boolean
    normalizeUnit
    Whether to normalize the cell to the unit circle
    String
    outstring
    Variable used in outputting to console
    int[][]
    partialProductTable
    Partial product table used in the neighborhood permutation multiplications
    int[][]
    ruleField
    Binary 2D array of integers of a Wolfram code calculation with given input that multiplicativeSolutionOutput() parallel multiplication operates
    int[][]
    ruleOutput
    Binary 2D array of the binary additive Wolfram code output
    double[][][]
    vectorField
    This is the multiplication result for each cell, just after the geometric mean, and just before the neighborhood normalization, each layer is the unit vector coefficient for that cell, Multiplications B, with non neg real floating point
    int
    widthOfRandomInput
    Width of random input to use
    boolean
    wolframIsNegOne
    If true, Wolfram code lookups that equal 1 negate the real or imaginary parts of the cell.

    Description
    int[][][]
    generatePolynomial(ValidSolution solution)
    Generates the algebraic polynomial of the permuted neighborhood multiplications, polynomial[row=0..places-1][term][place] is the term's exponents and polynomial[places][term][row] is the row's term coefficient.
    double
    geometricMean(double in, int numFactors)
    Geometric mean of the neighborhood's columns, in Multiplications B normalization, this is acting on each unit vector of the vector produced, non-negative real numbers
    double

    Result of neighborhood permutation multiplications, already factor-wise normalized by geometric mean, here normalized neighborhood-wise this time, by the binary weighted sum of the neighborhood acting on non-negative real numbers
    Complex

    Normalizes the neighborhood of the result of permutation multiplications to a single output cell, with the option to normalize it to the unit circle

      public double[][] field
      2D array of doubles with the coefficients of a multiplicativeSolutionOutput()

    • fieldFromPolynomial

      public double[][] fieldFromPolynomial
      same as field[][], except that field mutiplies out the whole numFactors-dim partialProduct[][] table, and this uses the polynomial from generatePolynomial()

    • ruleField

      public int[][] ruleField
      Binary 2D array of integers of a Wolfram code calculation with given input that multiplicativeSolutionOutput() parallel multiplication operates

    • ruleOutput

      public int[][] ruleOutput
      Binary 2D array of the binary additive Wolfram code output

    • partialProductTable

      public int[][] partialProductTable
      Partial product table used in the neighborhood permutation multiplications

    • factorLayers

      public int[][][] factorLayers
      Binary neighborhoods with a valid permutation group applied, each permutation creates a layer, each cell in a layer is a factor in the multiplication

    • vectorField

      public double[][][] vectorField
      This is the multiplication result for each cell, just after the geometric mean, and just before the neighborhood normalization, each layer is the unit vector coefficient for that cell, Multiplications B, with non neg real floating point

    • complexVectorField

      public Complex[][][] complexVectorField
      Output of a ValidSolution in multiplicativeSolutionOutput(), complex vector, Multiplications B just prior to normalization

    • complexField

      public Complex[][] complexField
      Output of a ValidSolution in multiplicativeSolutionOutput(), complex, Multiplications B, after normalization

    • currentSolution

      public ValidSolution currentSolution
      Solution currently being used

    • gridSize

      public int gridSize
      Number of columns in the output, must be larger than the input array parameter in multiplicativeSolutionOutput().

    • normalizeUnit

      public boolean normalizeUnit
      Whether to normalize the cell to the unit circle

    • wolframIsNegOne

      public boolean wolframIsNegOne
      If true, Wolfram code lookups that equal 1 negate the real or imaginary parts of the cell. If false, the Wolfram code lookups zero out the real or imaginary parts of the cell

    • avoidDivZero

      public boolean avoidDivZero
      If true, and if normalizeUnit is true, if the radius is zero, set it equal to 1 to avoid division by zero.

    • doAddititiveWolfram

      public boolean doAddititiveWolfram
      If true, it does a binary sum of the real and imaginary parts of the input neighborhood, greater than 0 being 0 and less than 0 being 1, the real and imaginary treated as seperate, and calls the solution's Wolfram code with that value, and depending on the Wolfram code value at that additive spot, it sets it to 0 or -1, depending on wolframIsNegOne

  • Constructor Details

    • ECAMpostProcessing

      public ECAMpostProcessing()
      Currently empty

  • Method Details

    • multiplicativeSolutionOutput

      public double[][] multiplicativeSolutionOutput(ValidSolution solution, int[] binaryInput, double[] doubleInput, int rows, int columns)
      Multiplications B, Uses a solution found in ECAasMultiplication and applies the same permutation group multiplication to a neighborhood of non-negative real numbers in addition to the standard binary Wolfram calculation. In this version the standard binary Wolfram code output moderates the non-negative real multiplications by only setting the cell's double value if the binary addtive Wolfram code call for that neighborhood is 1. The partialProduct[][] table is a class field set externally from this function. The partialProduct[][] table is a closed group of size numBits x numBits, typically Galois addition or multiplication

      Non-negative real hybrid with binary additive Wolfram code output

      Parameters:
      solution - user-supplied ValidSolution from ECAasMultiplication
      binaryInput - user-supplied binary array to use as input at row 0 in the ECA calculation
      doubleInput - user-supplied double array to use as coefficient input at row 0 in the ECA calculation
      rows - user supplied number of rows to calculate
      columns - user supplied number of columns to calculate
      Returns:
      a 2d double array of the solution applied to the given rule using random input

    • multiplicativeSolutionOutput

      public Complex[][] multiplicativeSolutionOutput(ValidSolution solution, Complex[] complexInput, int rows, int columns)
      Uses a solution found in ECAasMultiplication and applies the same permutations and constructions to a neighborhood of complex numbers. Multiplication B in the paper screenshot. Multiplication C is the other part of this function. Uses the solution's polynomial from generatePolynomial() to multiply, the partial product table was applied there.

      Complex

      Parameters:
      solution - user-supplied ValidSolution from ECAasMultiplication
      complexInput - user-supplied complex array to use as coefficient input at row 0 in the ECA calculation
      rows - user supplied number of rows to calculate
      columns - user supplied number of columns to calculate
      Returns:
      a 2d double array of the solution applied to the given rule using random input

    • geometricMean

      public double geometricMean(double in, int numFactors)
      Geometric mean of the neighborhood's columns, in Multiplications B normalization, this is acting on each unit vector of the vector produced, non-negative real numbers
      Parameters:
      in - double to average
      numFactors - number of factors used
      Returns:
      numFactors-th root of in

    • localNormalize

      public double localNormalize(double[] in)
      Result of neighborhood permutation multiplications, already factor-wise normalized by geometric mean, here normalized neighborhood-wise this time, by the binary weighted sum of the neighborhood acting on non-negative real numbers
      Parameters:
      in - double array with length places,
      Returns:
      a permuted ECA multiplication result normalized according to parameter useNorm

    • localNormalize

      public Complex localNormalize(Complex[] in)
      Normalizes the neighborhood of the result of permutation multiplications to a single output cell, with the option to normalize it to the unit circle
      Parameters:
      in - double array with length places,
      Returns:
      a permuted ECA multiplication result normalized according to parameter useNorm

    • generatePolynomial

      public int[][][] generatePolynomial(ValidSolution solution)
      Generates the algebraic polynomial of the permuted neighborhood multiplications, polynomial[row=0..places-1][term][place] is the term's exponents and polynomial[places][term][row] is the row's term coefficient. [Update] I changed this to include permuting these by the inverse of the permutation composition product for the final result

      Terms are lexicographically sorted in ascending order

      Parameters:
      solution - a ValidSolution from ECAasMultiplication
      Returns:
      the polynomial of the permuted factor multiplication for a single neighborhood

    • singleBitInput

      public int[][] singleBitInput(int[] wolframCode, int rows, int columns)
      Generates the standard binary additive Wolfram code calculation with single bit initial input using the given truth table
      Parameters:
      wolframCode - binary array of length powers of 2
      rows - number of rows to output
      columns - number of columns to output
      Returns:
      output of Wolfram code with single bit initial input;

    • polynomialAsStrings

      public String[] polynomialAsStrings(int[][][] polynomial)
      Outputs the given polynomial in String[] form, columnName[] is currently hard-coded but can be changed for other variable names
      Parameters:
      polynomial - array containing a polynomial from generatePolynomial()
      Returns:
      String[] version of polynomial[][][]

    • randomBinaryInput

      public int[] randomBinaryInput()
      Generates random binary data for multiplicativeSolutionOutput, this is used in parallel to the non-negative real version
      Returns:
      a binary array of width widthRandomInput

    • randomComplexInput

      public Complex[] randomComplexInput(double bottomRange, double topRange)
      Generates random complex row 0 data for multiplicativeSolutionOutput()
      Parameters:
      bottomRange - lower range of random input
      topRange - upper range of random input
      Returns:
      an array of random complex numbers

    • randomDoubleInput

      public double[] randomDoubleInput(int randRange, int randRangeMax)
      Generates random double data for multiplicativeSolutionOutput, non-negative real
      Parameters:
      randRange - lower bound of random input
      randRangeMax - upper bound of random input
      Returns:
      a random double array
